intro: Adhatoda guineensis, commonly known as African arrowroot or African sarsaparilla, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by elliptical, blue-black berries. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
